programme.desc: The presenter sets out to uncover the mysteries of King Tutankhamun. Along the way, he encounters the enigmatic Alien King Akhenaten and his wife, Nefertiti. Sailing down the Nile, he investigates how the Ancient Egyptians transported enormous stone blocks for their architectural marvels, including the 700-ton Colossi of Memnon. His quest then leads him into the Valley of the Kings, where he discovers the resting places of Akhenaten and King Tuts successor, Horemheb - before finally coming face to face with the mummy of the Boy King himself

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: Ancient Alien Carvings and Bigfoot Shrooms
programme.desc: An examination of several seemingly impossible things caught on film. A man believes he recorded Bigfoot on video while foraging for mushrooms. Plus, how rock paintings discovered in India might be proof of an ancient visitation and the capture of a fleet of UFOs on film crossing in front of the sun

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: The Nightcrawler and the Beast in the Tree
programme.desc: The team looks into a new sighting of Sasquatch in the trees of California. Plus, a man claims to have captured footage of the infamous Fresno Nightcrawlers in his back yard and mysterious streaks are witnessed in the night sky in Australia

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: The story of Britains first female agents sent to the front line during the Second World War and spymistress Vera Atkins, who led them. In the tumult of the conflict, French Resistance fighters sought aid from Britains Special Operations Executive (SOE) against Nazi occupation. Led by Romanian-born Atkins, SOE enlisted female agents including Odette Sansom and Noor Inayat Khan to take the fight to the Germans. As tensions soared, Noor navigated occupied France, while Atkins grappled with tough decisions. She and her team raced against time to safeguard SOEs mission, braving sacrifices for victory

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: The story of Britains first female agents sent to the front line during the Second World War and spymistress Vera Atkins, who led them. In the face of danger, Vera ramped up her recruitment of female agents. Chaos ensued as the Prosper circuit in Paris neared collapse. Meanwhile, Noor, deep in Parisian resistance, struggled to maintain cover. Vera enlisted agents like Violette Szabo and Yvonne Baseden, but uncertainty shrouds their upcoming missions

programme.title: Ramses the Great: King of Ancient Egypt
programme.desc: Merenptah, the 13th son of Ramses II, the great pharaoh of Ancient Egypt. Merenptah became pharaoh after his fathers long reign, when all of his older brothers had died. His reign was marked by feuds between rival branches of the family, and the throne was close to bankruptcy

programme.title: Historys Crazy Rich Ancients
programme.desc: Lavish dining is the epitome of living it up, and this programme reveals the rulers, tycoons and visionaries who spent jaw-dropping sums in pursuit of the rarest, the richest, and the most forbidden food and drink money could buy

programme.title: Historys Crazy Rich Ancients
programme.desc: The prized possessions of some of historys richest people havent been castles, jewels, or fine art, but something more exotic - with the ability to bite back. This programme focuses on the monarchs and millionaires who spent their fortunes collecting wild animals

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos, William Henry and Jason Martell through the archives of Ancient Aliens to uncover in-depth descriptions and portrayals of entities from Egyptian, Sumerian, Chinese, Mesoamerican and Native American traditions. Ancient Astronaut theorists propose that descriptions of sky gods and star beings might reflect real encounters with extraterrestrial visitors in the remote past

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Theorists investigate whether extraterrestrials might have inspired Adolf Hitler to embark on a crazed quest for global domination, and try to track down the Fuhrers alien secret

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the areas rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarchs reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Headless Romans and Anglo Saxon Gold
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about a gatehouse riddled with Civil War bullets, a unique Iron Age shield made from bark, and Roman burials with pots where the heads should be

programme.title: Weird Britain
programme.desc: Andy McGrath explores Devons pre-history in an ancient cavern, takes a crime-through-time tour of Dartmoors prison museum, and uncovers the terrifying legend behind Arthur Conan Doyles The Hound of the Baskervilles

programme.title: Rust Valley Restorers
programme.desc: Forest fires threaten Rust Valley and after his neighbour loses 350 cars, Mike hoards back fuel in case he needs to save his own collection, Cassidy leads the charge on a unique project for charity and James takes on an impossible job

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: Declassified files reveal bizarre military weapons policies, that somehow balance between apocalyptic and absurd. They include atomic tests 1,500 times stronger than Hiroshima to CIA poison guns and plots to feminise Hitler

programme.title: Myths and Monsters
programme.desc: The origins of famous legends from around Europe with leading scholars from British universities helping to explain the history behind these stories, the meanings hidden within and why they have endured. The first programme examines stories of heroes and the villains they encountered. Narrated by Nicholas Day

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: The Creeping Horror and Viral Car Jumpers
programme.desc: A quest for the truth behind internet videos of acrobats flipping over speeding cars and an amorphous and horrifying crawling creature believed by some to be from another planet

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: UFO on Fire and Dinosaur on the Beach
programme.desc: A prehistoric-looking creature washed ashore in Georgia and a strange object spotted in the sky apparently on fire. Plus, a toddlers death-defying experience

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: Amid the chaos of D-Day, alarming wireless messages revealed Special Operations Executive (SOE) disloyalty. While concerns escalated, Allied troops advanced and Paris was liberated. SOE operations subsequently dwindled, prompting Second World War spymistress Vera Atkins to confront the harm done to her agents

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: While Europe rejoiced over victory in the Second World War, Odette Hallowes struggle at Ravensbruck revealed telling information about other agents in prison. Spymistress Vera Atkins investigation intensified in Karlsruhe prison and Ravensbruck, focusing on espionage agent Noor Inayat Khans fate

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: An examination of various evidence found in religious texts and records from some of Earth’s earliest civilisations. Plus, a look at unexplained anomalies in human physiology, raising questions about how these features came to be. This exploration might lead to fascinating insights into the very nature of humanity

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts unseal the truth about the potential aliens living and working among humans

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Mystery Shipwreck and a Roman Army Camp
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about discoveries that shed new light on British history during the prehistoric, Roman, Saxon and Tudor eras. In this edition, she examines a Dutch ship sunk by the English, a Cornish Roman fort and a 5,000-year-old Neolithic monument

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Once Europes most popular 4x4, the Land Rover Freelander looks good, drives well, and is a perfect vehicle for FB as future values are set to rise. programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A Wisconsin collectors oversize storage units feature a variety of items including his prized pistol. A former drag racer opens the doors to his museum-quality stockpile of petroliana featuring home-made engine cutaways, a stable full of early Chevrolets and a must-have pick-up

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of staff at a pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas. When an early handheld video game system comes into play, Corey tries to make a deal

programme.desc: When the team deploys a cutting-edge new technology on Skinwalker Ranch to study the mysterious Bubble, it leads to an unsettling revelation

programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the history of the Welsh capitals landmark, Cardiff Castle, and discovers more about its various incarnations over the centuries. programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the history of York Castle, built on the orders of William the Conqueror and once the regional seat of British government. The castle has also been used as a prison and a royal mint, and in 1308, 25 Knights Templar were jailed there and examined on charges of heresy, idolatry and other crimes. The castle was also where Dick Turpin was held prior to his execution in 1739 and Dan tries to separate fact from fiction regarding the many myths to have developed about the infamous highwayman

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Berniers future is up in the air as the bargain-hunters head to an airport auction and compete for luggage and plane parts. programme.desc: A seemingly routine surveillance job takes a deadly turn for Catherine and her ex, Billy, leading the team to a hitman. But not everything in the parched landscape is wilted and bleak, on the edge of a rocky outcrop, an enormous tree boasts with large, leathery, heart-shape leaves. This is a Namaqua Rock fig, a tree of myth and fantasy

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: New York Giants v Philadelphia Eagles (Kick-off 1.15am). Coverage of the week six match from MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey, as the two NFC East sides go head to head. The Eagles have had the better of this fixture over the last 12 years having won 19 of the last 23 meetings between the two teams. Philadelphia won both games against the Giants last year including a 28-3 hammering in this match 12 months ago

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The ATP Shanghai Masters and the WTA Wuhan Open. Coverage of the events at Qizhong Forest Sports City Arena and Optics Valley International Tennis Center respectively. Eventual Shanghai champion Jannik SInner was a 6-4, 7-6 victor over Ben Shelton in round four last year. Twelve months ago in Wuhan, Aryna Sabalenka claimed a 6-4, 6-4 second-round victory over Katerina Siniaková en route to winning the title

programme.title: Live World Grand Prix Darts
programme.sub-title: World Grand Prix Darts D3 08.10 Leicester Mattioli Arena
programme.desc: Coverage of day three from Mattioli Arena in Leicester, featuring second-round matches, played over the best of five sets. In the closest match of the third day last year, Ryan Joyce claimed a 3-2 win over Nathan Aspinall. There was also a 3-1 victory for Rob Cross against Martin Schindler. Luke Humphries lost years final against Belgiums Mike De Decker 4-6 as the Belgian won his first ever televised title

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Pakistan. Coverage of the group match from R. Premadasa Stadium, Colombo, as the holders play their third group game of this years tournament. Australia have played in all 12 previous World Cups since the first in 1973, a competition that they finished runners-up in. Pakistan are playing in their sixth World Cup and have never reached the semi-finals before, something theyll be aiming to do this year

programme.desc: England v India. Action from the 2017 final, which took place at Lords, as the teams looked to succeed Australia as champions. These teams faced each other in the opening round of the round-robin fixtures, and on that occasion it was India who came out on top, winning by 35 runs

programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.sub-title: Capital One Cup Final 2013-Bradford City V Swansea City 24.02 Highlights
programme.desc: Bradford City v Swansea City. Highlights of the 2013 final at Wembley Stadium, where the League Two Bantams were aiming to produce yet another cup upset. Swansea were appearing in their first major cup final and beat Chelsea in the semi-finals to reach this stage, but Bradford had stolen most of the headlines in the competition this season, belying their lowly league status to eliminate the likes of Arsenal, Aston Villa and Wigan Athletic

programme.sub-title: 2025 Acciona Open De Espana Presented By Madrid Day 1
programme.desc: The Acciona Open De España Presented By Madrid. Coverage of day one at Club de Campo Villa de Madrid. Spanish golfers have dominated this event recently with five of the last six winners winning on home soil. Jon Rahm has won this competition three times since 2018 and holds the tournament record score after finishing on 25-under-par in 2022. Spains Angel Hidalgo won here last year after beating Rahm in a play-off after both finished on 14-under-par

programme.title: Live PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The Baycurrent Classic. Coverage of the second day of the tournament which takes place at Yokohama Country Club in Japan. Colombian golfer Nico Echavarria succeeded here last year as he finished one stroke clear of Americans Max Greyserman and Justin Thomas on 20-under-par. He became the first South American player to win this event and the first non-American to win here since 2021

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The ATP Shanghai Masters and the WTA Wuhan Open. Coverage of the events at Qizhong Forest Sports City Arena and Optics Valley International Tennis Center respectively. Eventual Shanghai champion Jannik SInner was a 6-4, 7-6 victor over Ben Shelton in round four last year. Twelve months ago in Wuhan, Aryna Sabalenka claimed a 6-4, 6-4 second-round victory over Katerina Siniaková en route to winning the title

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Pakistan. Coverage of the group match from R. Premadasa Stadium, Colombo, as the holders play their third group game of this years tournament. Australia have played in all 12 previous World Cups since the first in 1973, a competition that they finished runners-up in. Pakistan are playing in their sixth World Cup and have never reached the semi-finals before, something theyll be aiming to do this year

programme.title: Live World Grand Prix Darts
programme.sub-title: World Grand Prix Darts D3 08.10 Leicester Mattioli Arena
programme.desc: Coverage of day three from Mattioli Arena in Leicester, featuring second-round matches, played over the best of five sets. In the closest match of the third day last year, Ryan Joyce claimed a 3-2 win over Nathan Aspinall. There was also a 3-1 victory for Rob Cross against Martin Schindler. Luke Humphries lost years final against Belgiums Mike De Decker 4-6 as the Belgian won his first ever televised title

programme.desc: Dáithí Ó Se talks to Máire Ní Churraoi, from the Ráth Chairn Gaeltacht in Co Meath. Máire has cultivated a substantial online presence, she had over 103,000 TikTok followers and 52,000 on Instagram, sharing sean nos songs, conversations, language tutorials and cultural commentary

She reached elite levels in four different sports representing her country in soccer, basketball and rugby all the while playing intercounty football with Dublin. Her footballing success culminated in winning an All-Ireland title with Dublin 2010, the first ever for the countys women. Peats unwavering determination to constantly better herself in a sporting capacity helped mask underlying personal struggles with her sexuality and self-doubt which she eventually overcame and embraced in time

programme.desc: Climate change has upset the water cycle and natural freshwater reservoirs are at risk of disappearing so researchers are looking to new technologies to save drinking water. programme.title: Top Gear

James meets American rally driver Ken Block, and Jeremy tests out the Mercedes SL Black. Comedian Michael McIntyre is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and James May test the Porsche Panamera against the Royal Mails delivery service, racing a first-class letter to see which travels faster over the full length of the British Isles. Jeremy Clarkson gets chased by the British Army in some of their most deadly toys, and multi Olympic gold medal-winning sprinter Usain Bolt is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef retraces a road trip he took in 1968 down the Pacific Coast Highway to the Mexican border and beyond. He begins in San Francisco, the home of sourdough and where Americas love affair with seasonal cooking took hold through restaurants like Chez Panisse, run by Alice Waters, who Rick is keen to meet. The chef also reflects on the time he had his first taste of Mexican food

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Chicken and Egg
programme.sub-title: The Hairy Bikers Chicken and Egg - UK
programme.desc: The duo set out on a new culinary mission, biking across Europe, the Middle East and America to find and cook the most delicious chicken and egg recipes in the world. They start out on home turf, where they demonstrate how to ensure the perfect roast chicken every time, find out how chickens first came to the UK and make cakes and Welsh rarebit at a country show in Wales. As they celebrate the British passion for poultry, other recipes include chicken and leek suet pudding and scotch eggs

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team is given two days and a $20,000 budget to remove a 10-metre steel-hulled yacht from Cockburn Beach in Western Australia. The problem is the boat is buried deep in the sand and is a danger to beach goers. Heavy machinery specialist Ryan is going to use his monster excavator to try and get the job done, but theres a catch - to make the budget work, Luke needs Ryan to be done and dusted in 24 hours.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team heads to Harvey Estuary in Western Australia to try and recover a 36-foot plywood vessel called Endeavour II that sunk in a wild storm. What appears to be a straightforward job on paper turns into an absolute nightmare. Job two is a charitable cause close to Lukes hear, as he and Jacinta team-up with mens mental health charity Squared Away to try and rescue a historic boat that is about to sink

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are each challenged to find a classic car at auction for £3,000. Exploring whether they are more fun to drive than modern alternatives, the trio then take the vehicles to Majorca to compete in a rally. Jeremy also test-drives the BMW Z4 and Nissan 370Z, and AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef continues down the Californian coastline immortalised by John Steinbeck, a region of citrus groves and vineyards. On the edge of Los Angeles, Rick discovers Olvera Street, where the Hispanic origins of the city took root. Then heading south to San Diego, he meets 79-year-old Peter Halmay, the oldest sea-urchin diver in town, and is served the best fish chilli he has ever had by a local fishmonger

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Chicken and Egg
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers set out to discover why French chickens have gained a reputation for being the poshest birds on the planet. Beginning their quest in Lyon, the pair discover the origins of haute cuisine, before heading to a farm for an introduction to the famous poulet de Bresse. They also enjoy chicken dishes created by some of the countrys finest chefs, and then head for Daves new home in Northern France to prepare a feast for his neighbours. Finally, the boys arrive in Paris, where they cook an iconic French casserole, coq au vin, against the backdrop of the Eiffel Tower

programme.title: The Royle Family

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The team are in the Cotswolds to save single mum Sally from her chaotic and clutter-filled home. Sally lives with 19-year-old daughter Hannah and 18-year-old son Josh, and works full time from home as a childminder. Her jam-packed house doubles up as a workspace, and sadly for her kids, work has taken over, and it no longer feels like home. Nick hopes to create an effective work environment, a sanctuary for Sally and a space for the kids

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: John and Lynn love the ample space and beautiful backyard of their home - they watched their two daughters grow up there and cant imagine living anywhere else

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Jennifer, Paul and their son Brendan live in the perfect neighbourhood, but their outdated and rundown house is anything but perfect

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: When Terry Guest had a brain injury, he was left with severe disabilities, and the only care available for him was an old peoples dementia care home, where he remained for several years. His sister Tracey offered help, but like Terrys home, her house was also unsuitable. Nick Knowless regulars and a team of South Yorkshire volunteers and suppliers step in to adapt Traceys home and build Terry his own separate pad at the end of the garden

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Its a race against time as the contestants have 90 minutes to use across two rounds and come up with two courses

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson presents a pared-down approach to cuisine in which she reveals that what people cook and how they prepare it really can make them feel better and more alive. She prepares avocado toast with radishes for breakfast, a Thai noodle dish with cinnamon and prawns, and a laid-back family supper of seeded lamb ribs, served with a feta and avocado salad. Nigella also serves her warm-spiced cauliflowers and chicksalad and a sweet treat in the form of an apricot almond cake

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows Kirstine and Phil, who have not spent a day apart in four years, but following an emergency during labour the pair find themselves separated. Cameras also focus on independent businesswoman Tyla. While awaiting the arrival of her third child, she starts to reconsider her romantic future. And although Spanish nurses Carlota and Javier epitomise the perfect relationship, the pair realise that labour can be challenging even for the best of partnerships

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Career woman Charlene, 35, is struggling to comes to terms with the fact she is about to become a mum, after dedicating her life to climbing the career ladder. Her mother Marion and Aunt Bev use Liverpudlian humour to help her through the final stages of labour. Cameras also follow Jess, 21, who fell pregnant after a fling and only truly believed the news when she saw her first scan. Plus, Sam, 41, who swore she would never have another child after the traumatic birth of her first, is convinced her late mother is in the labour room with her

programme.title: Bad Girls Behind Bars
programme.desc: An intimate look at life for women in the Western Massachusetts Regional Womens Correctional Centre. Cameras follow notorious gang member Baby D, who considers herself to be the prisons most powerful inmate, and has her sights set on a woman in a rival gang for her next attack. Pregnant Vanessa arrives, and after losing custody of her other children, she is desperate to secure a place on a drug rehabilitation programme. Will she get out of prison before the birth?

programme.title: Bad Girls Behind Bars
programme.desc: Transgender inmate Franklin falls in love with a fellow prisoner, but they must keep their relationship a secret or face being placed in solitary confinement. A fight breaks out over a carton of milk, and a pregnant prisoner trying to recover from heroin addiction faces losing a place on a treatment programme - which could result in her baby being born in prison and taken from her

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants are sent to Wotton House, a grand hotel in the Surrey Hills, where they must each transform one of the nine bedrooms to create a space that reflects their signature style but with an eccentric British twist. The designers relish the challenge, embracing the idea of British eccentricity, although some take a more liberal approach, leading to surprising results. Alan Carr follows their progress, while helping Michelle Ogundehin survey the spaces is guest judge Guy Oliver, who has designed the interiors for some of the best-known hotels in London

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: V and Ollie blue light to a rugby pitch to help a man who had a seizure. Plus, Stef and Lee treat an excitable 6-year-old Spider-Man fighting an asthma attack

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: Nick is in Deal, Kent, where mum Donna and dad John are avid collectors whose memorabilia has left their house full, and the teenage kids feeling pushed out by junk. To restore harmony, Nick first has to fight his way through piles of Liverpool FC items, mums Take That souvenirs, and a crushing amount of Christmas clutter

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Hillary and Trae moved into their spacious 1970s split-level home eight years ago - they have an open layout and so must renovate everything all at once

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Tenny and Lyle are excited to bring their two families together, but they need a game-changing renovation to make the house work for a more family-oriented lifestyle

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles is in Bidford-on-Avon, Warwickshire, to meet Chloe, who has a rare genetic disorder that means she has to stay in the living room of her familys house under constant care. The DIY SOS team are joined by Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and hundreds of Warwickshire volunteers to redesign the entire house to provide Chloe with independence, creating a self-contained apartment complete with bedroom, wet room and sitting room

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Judge Andy Allen presents an Everything Mystery Box to challenge the contestants with unusual flavours to be combined into one dish

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: West Midlands paramedics come to the aid of a student with a dislocated knee, and a child who has ingested a dangerous liquid

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: The film-maker looks back on his documentaries about the criminal justice system in the US. Louis reflects on his reports on the prison system, which exposed a world with its own rules and codes and a system that seemed to be broken. He also revisits the documentaries he shot in Philadelphia and Milwaukee, where tensions between the African-American community and the police were already at boiling point years before the death of George Floyd

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: The film-maker looks back on his documentaries focused on families, including his trilogy of documentaries centred around the Westboro Baptist Church. He examines how the death of patriarch Fred Phelps has left members of the church divided. He also reflects on how physical and mental health or forces beyond control can threaten to derail family lives

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Return of the documentary capturing daily life on the busy maternity ward in Southmead Hospital, Bristol. Mel, 35, is expecting fourth-generation twins and when her waters break, the expectant mum has to choose whether husband Chris or her identical twin sister Cheryl will be her birthing partner. Larger-than-life Su, 36, felt she had hit the jackpot when she met younger man Dan, 28, and the couple arrive at Southmead in high spirits. Their baby is in breech so the couple have been booked for a Caesarean - but their plans soon change. Meanwhile, Rob is praying for a son as partner Katy is rushed to the delivery suite

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: When Marion, 30, and Rachel, 32, wanted to start a family they went in search of a sperm donor and ended up with twins, but at their 30-week scan, the couple are told one of the babies is not growing properly and they must return to Southmead Hospital the next day for a C-section. Image-conscious Sarah, 28, and her husband, 40-year-old personal trainer Rob, reach a compromise over baby names in the delivery suite, while 39-year-old Ollie arrives armed with blankets, rugs and all the essentials to make sure his expectant wife, 33-year-old Kate, is as comfortable as possible

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers go back to school as they transform students common rooms - and Michelle Ogundehin ups the stakes by telling them that the weakest two will be eliminated this week. Arriving at Gordano School in Bristol, the contestants work in pairs to update the four tired areas - one for each house in the school - as well as adjoining teachers offices. Alan Carr follows their progress, while guest judge Sophie Robinson offers her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Anna and Darren treat a woman suffering from terminal cancer. Laura and Kerry are called to attend a young man with a painful abscess in his throat

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels across New York state, discovering how General Electric also leads the way in rail technology and examining the story behind George Eastmans Kodak company. He then visits Buffalo and discovers the history behind its grain industry, followed by a trip to witness the awesome power and drama of Niagara Falls

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Philadelphia, and pays tribute to its fictional son, Rocky Balboa. He finishes the latest leg of his journey in Gettysburg, the most famous battlefield of the American Civil War, where President Abraham Lincoln made a momentous speech in 1863

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul collects a cherished 1924 Rover 9 thats been in the same family since the 1950s and only had one previous owner before that

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads north to pick up a 1954 Morgan +4 coupe in mint condition and believed to be just one of three still on the road

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Hermann Goering - the dashing, young, down-on-his-luck war veteran who turned into an extravagant, heartless, obese, drug-addled Nazi billionaire

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Trentham Gardens near Stoke-on-Trent, where items featured include an early camera which had previously been used for natural history photography, a dagger with a gruesome history, a shawl that once belonged to a movie star, and a small 18th-century figurine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Lyme Park in Cheshire, famously the location for the 1995 TV adaptation of Pride and Prejudice. Items brought in to be valued include a pair of pistols used to protect royal mail coaches from highwaymen, a tea caddy disguised as a pile of books, and a portrait of actress Sarah Bernhardt that once belonged to Elton John

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek takes a shine to a rare 1958 Armstrong Siddeley Sapphire with a long family history and a convertible Triumph Herald brings a few smiles on auction day

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives at a milestone on his American journey as he reaches the boundary between the northern and southern states, known as the Mason-Dixon line. Beginning in Wilmington, North Carolina, he uncovers the history of gunpowder production in Delaware, before heading to Baltimore, where he discovers how the first American steam engine owed a lot to British technology. On the citys east coast, Michael visits the star-shaped Fort McHenry, and learns how the Star-Spangled Banner national anthem was born

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Continuing his trek from Philadelphia to Jamestown, Michael Portillo arrives in the nations capital, Washington, DC, centre of political power in the worlds most powerful country. Steered by his Appletons Guide of 1879, he admires its fine public buildings, including the largest library in the world, and discovers how the capital was built from scratch after a political compromise between north and south. After this, he travels on to Mount Vernon, exploring a former slave market and visiting an archaeological dig along the way

programme.desc: The Walshes reach northern Thailand, where Barney arranges for him and Bradley to see the jungle on a rollercoaster. The next day sees the pair face their biggest challenge - climbing into an ominous cavern named the Anxiety State Crisis Cave - before ending their trip in a temple where they reminisce about their adventures

programme.title: The Hack
programme.desc: DCS Dave Cook is assigned to investigate the unsolved murder of private detective Daniel Morgan, the most investigated homicide in the history of the Metropolitan Police. As he is drawn deeper into the case, Dave finds himself under surveillance by the News of the World. When his private and work lives are put under pressure, Dave begins to pursue the case ruthlessly and takes up matters with Rebekah Wade, the News of the Worlds powerful editor

programme.title: The Group Chat
programme.desc: Richard Chambers, Gavan Reilly and Zara King discuss the main news stories of the week in an extended round-table conversation

programme.title: The Tower
programme.desc: Sarah and Elaine are called to a brutal hit-and-run, uncovering a disturbing link to their ongoing investigation. Kieran urges Lizzie not to reveal the secrets of Operation Perseus

programme.title: Antisocial Ireland
programme.desc: Virgin Media News Crime Correspondent Sarah OConnor investigates the apparent rise in anti-social behaviour across the country. The documentary examines Garda efforts to clamp down on public order offences and talk to victims who feel abandoned by the authorities, and also hears from community representatives and outreach workers trying to tackle anti-social tendencies among young people before they manifest in violence

programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan is pushed hard by retired PR executive Jayne, who is looking to make a big return on several designer handbags to help pay for her daughter Charlottes fairy tale wedding. In Cheshires golden triangle, Kathy meets savvy watch collector Anthony who is looking to trade up his collection of luxury watches for one worth more than £100,000

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Tara can only build temporary structures on a piece of Wiltshire land she inherited. Using a reassembled corrugated metal shed, Simon devises a plan to create a tiny off-grid eco shed that will be a unique place to stay

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: When an unpopular pub landlord is beaten to death, a police informant casts suspicion on his ex-wife and her new husband. Plus, the case of gamekeeper Billy Stirrat, whose life was turned upside down following a miscarriage of justice involving his wrongful arrest for the possession of £500,000 worth of amphetamine

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A group of young offenders come to stay at Ashfordly Hall, but soon find themselves under suspicion after a spate of disturbances in the village. Meanwhile, Blaketon and Ventress go on the hunt for a spinsters missing dog, and a £50 reward gives Peggy an idea. Rural drama, starring Rupert Vansittart, William Simons, Derek Fowlds and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Ruth Watson advises Keith and Val Morris on ways to revamp their failing hotel and conference centre the Hanmer Arms, which is losing money despite being large and well-equipped. She explains why the lack of a full-time receptionist and permanent head chef mean problems with continuity - and urges the reluctant and negative owners to boost their dwindling bookings by attracting corporate clients

Starring Michael Starke, Amy Robbins and Robert Daws, and featuring a guest appearance by Tricia Penrose in her Heartbeat guise of Gina Ward

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police investigate a hit-and-run incident in Ashfordly and discover evidence suggesting it may have been an act of revenge - with the victims own mother-in-law one of the possible suspects. Recruited by DI James Marsh and DS Ashleigh Francis, Alison proves invaluable as she assists in surveilling a gang planning a major heist, while she also has to navigate her mothers financial struggles, a broken relationship, and the ableist attitudes she encounters at work. Crime drama, starring Rose Ayling-Ellis, Andrew Buchan and Charlotte Ritchie

programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the friendly at Wembley Stadium.
